pages.text: $(item)Smoldered Purpeille$() is used to engrave items into formations named $(bold)Warpaths$().$(br2)In some End Cities, we have found chalk inscriptions on the Purpur walls. The compound used seems to have been an ashen-metallic blend; when we tested it against $(item)Smoldered Purpeille$(), it matched.

The inscriptions were few, so we could not assemble a rigorous script, but the message was clear.$(br2)Warpaths can be engraved on any piece of Purpeille equipment. The most basic of Warpaths is created by placing one of those items and a $(item)Smoldered Purpeille Ingot$() in a crafting table. You can create a Warpath with any orientation; the slot of the ingot matters, but the equipment's does not.

pages.title: Engraved Sword
pages.text: Here is an engraved $(item)Purpeille Sword$(). Hold your finger over the illustration to view its Warpath. 'Totality' is a $(bold)Revelation$(): the base component of a Warpath. This particular Revelation is created upon placing the Smoldered Purpeille in the third crafting slot.

You might also notice that holding this item will give a health bonus. Indeed, each Revelation provides a unique and temporary bonus to your person when equipped.$(br2)Tools and weapons should be held in your main hand, and armor should be worn for their bonuses.$(br2)Experiment with different Revelations, but do not craft the result yet; there is more to explore.
